titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Evan Shelby Connell Papers M1961
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Ivan Josh Henriquez Nunez

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-03-19T10:57-0700

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

physdesc.extent: (44 manuscript boxes; two half baoxes; 3 flat boxes; 1 carton)

did.abstract: Manuscripts, correspondence, photographs, ephemera, and audiovisual material, documenting the life and career of American author Evan Shelby Connell (1924-2013).

accessrestrict.head: Access to Collection
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research use. Audio-visual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94305-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/spc/using-collections/permission-publish.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into six series:

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was given by Evan S. Connell to Stanford University, Special Collections in November, 2013.

processinfo.head: Processing note
processinfo.p: The collection was processed by Ivan Josh Henriquez Nunez.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Evan Shelby Connell Papers (M1961). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains manuscripts, correspondence, photographs, ephemera, and audiovisual material. The manuscripts include the original working drafts and notes, with numerous subsequent drafts and typescripts of the majority of the nineteen works written and published by Connell, most notably Mrs. Bridge (1959), Mr. Bridge (1969), and Son of the Morning Star (1984). The correspondence consists of letters he received from 1946 to late 2012 from agents, publishers, authors, colleagues, and friends.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: American author (and editor and pilot), Evan Shelby Connell (1924-2013) was born in Kansas City and died in Santa Fe. He was a versatile writer, praised for his spare portrayal of repression within a fictional upper-class Midwestern family in his novels Mrs. Bridge (1959) and Mr. Bridge (1969), as well as for his account of the very real and bloody battle that was Custer's Last Stand in his non-fiction book Son of the Morning Star (1984).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains miscellaneous material, including memo books, financial records, and Connell's copy of his Boy Scouts' handbook.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series includes letters from publishers, editors, agents, and other writers, as well as some personal correspondence. Correspondents include Herbert Gold, Kay Boyle, Don Carpenter, Barnaby Conrad, Janet (Lewis) Winters, Alice Adams, Nicholas Delbanco, Annie Dillard, Lewis Lapham, John Updike, Wallace Stegner (1948), Walter Van Tilburg Clark, Fannie Hurst, "Max" of the Paris Review, Elizabeth McKee, and Helen Taylor of Viking (extensively critiquing Connell's work as submitted); also George Plimpton, Italo Calvino (1960), Kenneth Rexroth, Carolyn Kizer, William Styron, Terry Southern, David Stacton, Gale Garnett, cartoonist William Hamilton, James Salter, and others. Clippings, ephemera, and some drafts that accompanied correspondence have been retained in this series. Correspondence is arranged roughly in chronological order.

did.unittitle: Unsorted Correspondence and clippings, varies dates

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series includes annotated drafts, manuscripts, typescripts, and proofs for Connell's fiction, non-fiction, and screenplay adaptations. Materials are arranged in roughly alphabetical order by title.

scopecontent.p: This series includes portraits of Connell and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains art gallery exhibit catalogues, literary journals, and clippings.

accessrestrict.head: Access to Collection
accessrestrict.p: Audio-visual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series of consists of audiocassettes and VHS tapes containing audio and film adaptations of Connells writings; also included are recorded interviews with Connell.
